Reviews.Title: Hit Or Miss Quality & Functionality
Reviews.Author: Perfectly Funny Wanderer
Reviews.Content: The camera just came out but doesn't live up to the hype and reviews I had read.  This is based on about 2 weeks of use, indoor and outdoor, including an indoor speaker event, a large outdoor rally on the mall in Washington DC, a party, a hike in a park during autumn, and various other activities.  The camera is physically well-designed and manufactured with quality materials & construction.Biggest Issue: picture quality is hit-or-miss, mostly miss.  Quality for both color and sharpness was occasionally excellent, and typically like a cell-phone camera.  There are over a dozen interesting settings, such as sports and landscape modes, and they didn't help enough to solve the picture quality & consistency issue.Other Cons:most of the controls are on-screen, and these are not always fast to operate (such as zoom in & out, and changing photo settings)menu system is not as helpful or intuitive as it could be, so sometimes it was easier to turn off and on instead of navigating.the camera has internal memory that always came up first when reviewing photos... had to click through several menu options to view today's photos by date just to see the most recent photo taken.  And everyone wants to see how they look in the photo you just took, so it wasted a lot of time.video is HD but grainy at timesauto-focus seemed slow to kick in at times (this may be setting-dependent)time stamp on video files was different by several hours and minutes from the time stamp for photos (on Win 7 PC).Pros:Pinch-and-zoom touchscreen works nicelythe optical zoom is all inside the camera, and will stay clean... and worked well.when it took nice photos, the 10+ megapixels were nice to have for printing, cropping, etc.small and slimhas some internal memoryboots up fast enoughOverall the camera works okay for taking photos & video, but appears to almost be defective in execution.  Given the price (upper 200's) it is not going to be kept (even if I have to eat the cost of returning it plus Amazon's fee of apparently 15% for opened items.)  Researching the other new Nikon - Nikon Coolpix P7000 10.1 MP Digital Camera with 7.1x Wide Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens and 3-Inch LCD.Original Review Nov 10, 2010.Update Nov 24, 2010: I bought the Nikon Coolpix P7000 and it has the superb quality & features that I hoped would have been better delivered in the S80.  I've sent the S80 back to Amazon.Also, since this camera comes in many colors, check the reviews of other colors (Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.5-Inch OLED Touch Screen and 5x Wide Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens (Red) (many reviews) , Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.5-Inch OLED Touch Screen and 5x Wide Zoom-Nikkor ED Lens (Black) ).  Hope this review is helpful to you as you shop.

Reviews.Title: Better than most
Reviews.Author: Bobbi
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 compact camera's and boy have they been horrible.  This camera was more than I wanted to spend but it was worth it! It is not going to be one of those camera's that take great pictures in fast motion, but it does take pictures when someone is moving which is more than I can say for other small cameras.  The other feature that I really liked was it did not take FOREVER to take a picure in the dark and for me to view it.  If you want an awesome camera, well you will have to buy the larger more expenive ones, but for an easy to carry and understand, good camera, this one I liked.

Reviews.Title: Slick, Sleek and Portability
Reviews.Author: Trapshooter "UncleGuido"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Nikon S80  two-and-a-half months ago, and I have shot about a thousand shots with it.  I bought it because I wanted a camera that performed decently, and had a slim body so that it could be easily carried in a jacket or suit pocket.  I give it four stars because it provides what I expected from a small, sleek camera, and fits a niche in my camera stable which was missing.  I have had a few bad shots, but frankly most of these bloopers were due to my own fault in not practicing enough with the camera and exploring its capabilities.I am shortly leaving on a trip, and wanted to carry a point-and-shoot with me for quick shots when I was not carrying my larger Canon EOS Rebel T1i 15.1 MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Body Only).  I put it to a head-to-head comparison with my Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver) "point-and-shoot", and found that the images on the Canon were perceptibly sharper, shooting a blank stucco wall on my house, with overcast lighting.  A tripod was used for all shots.  I shot at various ISO's, and the results on the  Canon were consistently better quality.  To be fair, the Nikon has a fixed lens, and the Canon has a more sophisticated system.  But, of course, the Canon was more bulky.Here are the pros:1.  The camera has such a slim body that it can be easily be carried in a suit or shirt pocket without any bulk.  It is a pretty little camera.2.  The touch screen is large, and gives a good view of the subject to be photographed.3.  The touch screen controls are easy to get used to, and the lack of ability to fine tune the shutter speed and aperture make shooting pretty simple.4.  The software which accompanies the camera is very good and user friendly.5.  The ability to shoot by touching the screen is a nice feature.6.  The camera will charge when connected to the computer through the USB cable which is provided.  If you are traveling with a laptop computer, you don't have to worry about carrying around bulky chargers and cords.  The USB cable connection both charges and acts to transfer the photos from the camera to your computer.7.  The ability to record a memo with the shots is a nice feature.8.  Movies are of decent quality.9.  There is a 2-second timer (as well as a 10-second), which is nice for shots taken with a tripod where you just want to avoid camera shake which comes with depressing the shutter release.And the Cons:1.  The quality of the photos is good, but the small fixed lens does not have the ability to deliver the sharpness you will get with a more complex lens system.2.  The touch screen is both a pro and a con.  Sometimes you will trigger the shutter release inadvertently.  But this is a minor problem, since the photos are digital and you can erase them at no cost.  The touch screen electronics are not instantaneous, and sometimes there is a slight delay between the touch and the camera's response.3.  The lightness and lack of bulk is, again, both a pro and a con.  The lack of bulk contributes to a fair amount of camera shake.  The vibration reduction system helps with this, but in the movie mode you really need something like a tripod or monopod to steady the camera.4. Without an eyepiece, you are at the mercy of the sunshine reflecting off the back of the touch screen.  It is difficult to use in sunny conditions.If you are looking for the ability to fine-tune your shots by working with the AV and TV settings, and require a lot of flexibility in how you set up your "point-and-shoot", this camera would probably not meet your needs.  But if you are looking for a camera which scores high on portability, simplicity, good looks, and decent functioning on both still shots and movies, this camera may be for you.

Reviews.Title: Returned the Camera
Reviews.Author: Nat
Reviews.Content: Touch screen was a nightmare (finicky and unresponsive). Flash didn't activate often. The few times it did, a mysterious blotch appeared on some of my downloaded pictures: a small gray blotch with a yellow halo, NOT in the same area of my few flash pics, so not related to perhaps lens dirt, impossible to remove with retouch feature on Picasa!To add insult to injury, Best Buy wanted to charge me a re-stocking fee within the 14 days return because, according to their Geek Squad's one minute evaluation, the camera was NOT defective ! Really? I offered the link to my online Picasa album ( 40 of the 125 pics decent enough to upload online) and requested the store manager --- a VERY unpleasant buying experience!Like other reviewers, I selected this model because I incorrectly assumed that "More expensive means superior". Wrong!Unfortunately too new to have online reviews when I purchased Oct 23rd.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I've had a Canon Powershot for years, but it was recently stolen so I decided to try the Nikon Coolpix.  I actually bought one of the more expensive ones thinking it would be one of the best...boy was I wrong.  This camera is awful.  Most of our pictures are blown out from poor exposure or blurry because the flash doesn't activate when it should.  When it does manage to have decent exposure, the pictures don't even look that good.  The large touch screen is the best feature, however, it's a little slow and sometimes I would accidently touch the screen while I was taking a pic and change the settings.  Luckily I bought this camera from Costco so we can return it.  I'm switching back to a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Simply impressive
Reviews.Author: Pablo Aguirre
Reviews.Content: I have worked with professional, semi-professional and amateur cameras, so I know the difference between the kind of use a user would give to this kind of device. I read some negative reviews about this camera and I was very concerned about the product I bought, but when I started using it, it simply turn out to be a very impressive camera.There may be some features that a professional user may find out to be lacking improvement, but a common user would be glad to have what he paid for.My needs of this camera was a point-and-shoot with a clear wide screen, compact, a lot of mega pixels, high definition videos and simple to use. Every need I have was more than satisfied with this product.Screen: has a very good resolution and the touching features is completeley responsive in every way.Compact: the camera is as thin as it gets and built in a hard case, so it look pretty resistant.A lot of mega pixels: well, 14 mega pixels are more than enough.High Definition: videos look very good in TV.Simple to use: this is a quite interesting feature. The icon based screen is very friendly and do not interfere with the image of the picture you are taking.Plus: the touch screen have some features than turn out to be helpfull during a photo shooting, like registering the target to be shot with a simple touch, and watch the camera follow the target with the focus.The touch screen is also multi touch, so zooming in and out in a taken picture, is pretty cool, plus other touch screen gestures.The album feature and the rating feature for your pictures makes it very fun to organize your tons of images.Summerizing, I think it is worth the price.If you want an tablet to work as a computer, you would be dissapointed. Same with this camera. If you want it to work as a professional camera, you would be dissapointed. But if you want a high tech toy to take pictures in a fun way with a very high performance, you got it.I'm a very satisfied customer, and I love my camera.

Reviews.Title: Major design flaws
Reviews.Author: meepmeep
Reviews.Content: I regret buying this, and I'm really surprised that Nikon made such silly mistakes:1. Cannot review your photos without sliding open and exposing the lens.2. Slide cover opens all the time in my handbag, running down battery and risking the lens.3. Poor, sluggish touch screen - slow and inaccurate zoom control, really frustrating trying to cycle through photos. Lots of angry finger-stabbing.4. Very slow to take the next picture - lots of missed / late shots5. DOES NOT OFFER WIDE ANGLE / FISH EYE even though they claim it does

Reviews.Title: deceptive
Reviews.Author: Sibtain Kerai
Reviews.Content: very easy to use and simple in design. however, in spite of all the specs it boasts, picture quality leaves much to be desired. indoor photographs and anything in artificial lighting have a very mediocre picture quality. Also, it would be nice to have a battery indicator!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my Canon broke and I wanted to try a new brand.  This camera looked cool- with its touch screen and ability to "draw" on pictures. The problem is- the picture quality is AWFUL. We are talking indoors and outdoors.  It could not take one decent picture...too much red-eye, out-of-focus pictures and the biggest problem too much flash. I tried all setting and functions (believe me I tried).  AWFUL quality is an understatement and I am the average camera user- taking pictures of kids and friends, etc.Needless to say after a few days, I returned the camera and got a new Canon.  I am writing this review as a warning.  Do not buy this- even if it seems cool because of the touchscreen- the pictures are awful.I only gave it one star because Amazon would not let me give it ZERO stars.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S80
Reviews.Author: Joe in Michigan
Reviews.Content: I buy a new camera every year because I like having the latest features, innovations, and gadgets. I thought my last Nikon had all the features and there was nothing left to offer on a camera, but I was surprised by the S80. How does Nikon think of this stuff. It took me a few days to fully understand all this camera could do and I couldn't be happier with the results. I have taken almost a thousand pictures with it under all types of conditions both indoor and outdoor and I have excellent prints and onscreen viewing. If you are looking for a pocket camera that can do it all, buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: MadJack
Reviews.Author: MadJack
Reviews.Content: Easy and fun to use and takes great pix. The OLED screen is awesome! Can't say I miss those small knobs and buttons on other cameras, the touch screen is a must have. Hard to believe they can fit all that technology into such a small and well designed frame. I could go on and on.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for your Buck
Reviews.Author: Wendell Moore
Reviews.Content: I'v owned this camera for about 3wks. now and I always get the gleaming stares to begin with. This camera has features that I haven't begun to explore and it only gets better. The Image quality is excellent especially in low light situations. My only problem are the finger prints and the constant cleaning to keep my vivid OLED screen up to mark. Excellent buy at the Amazon price point of 260 average. Presently the ENVY of all my friends. Will update as I continue to explore its features.... Still give it a five star rating...

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: James D. Sheetz "jdsheetz"
Reviews.Content: I hesitated before buying this because of some questionable reviews.  I have not found ANY of the issues that others seemed to find annoying.  The camera works perfectly and the picture quality is excellent.  It does what I ask it to do.  No complaints.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: alabamagirl
Reviews.Content: I got this new camera for my birthday, and I absolutely love it! It takes great quality pictures and is so easy to use. It also has so many special features...I can't wait to learn how to use all of them.

Reviews.Title: A pro's pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: M Hinkel
Reviews.Content: I am a pro photographer, and I was looking for a camera that was small enough to pocket in my jeans and easy to use. A no brainer type of camera. It had to be around $100. I tried several other top brand names and I was unimpressed. So I went for my favorite brand Nikon and was able to get this and I'm amazed. I always try to keep a camera with me so I never miss a shot. This camera works great for what I need. The colors are vibrant, but with one touch of the screen you can create a black and white. I also purchased it for the higher ISO (6400) than most cameras in this price range. The video is 16:9 wide screen in 720p. Sound is recorded through a left and right receiver to provide a good clear sound. I have yet to try it in very loud sound situations. If someone asks me what they should get for a point and shoot camera. I tell them this one because its cheap, small, powerful, easy to use, and provides great images and video.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP Touch Screen Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Adonis
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and simple...I'm a little disappointed with the picture quality even on 14 MP setting.  Some pictures come out OK some are blurry.  There is also a lag after each shot.  You have to wait at least 2-3 seconds for the next shot.  I also tried the continous shot mode but the quality of the pictures aren't great.I do love the touch screen, size and video feature.  I'm just glad that I didn't pay full price b/c there are cheaper point and shoot cameras that have better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: rio "Rio"
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend asked me what i wanted for my birthday and i had been wanting a digital camera. i found this one and showed it to her. i got it for my birthday and I love it and i really can't find a problem with it.some pics of myself come out bad but thats because i'm just ugly ha ha ha jk. super cheap here on amazon probably the cheapest i seen i read other reviews before i got and i saw complaints but i have none. very slim, the slide is also what turns the camera on and off. no buttons besides the one and only picture button. got here fast no problems but your gonna have to buy a memory card because its not included. the oled monitor is completely touch. the only bothersome thing about touch screen products is everything sets it off. it has a touch feature were it takes a picture when the screen is touched that can be deactivated. good product buy it.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Sleek
Reviews.Author: shihnid
Reviews.Content: Cons: I wish there was a way to view the pictures without having to slide the front because the lens are exposed while viewing, which gives it a greater chance of getting fingerprints on the lens.  It's hard to see the screen on a bright sunny day. I definitely recommend getting an anti-glare screen protector for this reason (it'll also prevent smudges and scratches). There may be a contrast setting but I haven't played around too much with the settings yet.  The battery will drain when video recording so I would recommend getting extra batteries.Pros: It's very easy to use. It's fast enough that you can take multiple pics one after another without a delay. Picture and video quality are great. I love the slim feature where I can just slide it in my pocket or fit it into a wristlet. Overall it's a great camera and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Cute, but has quality problems
Reviews.Author: John Nagle "downside"
Reviews.Content: It's very cute, but it's not very well made.Out of the box, it had a dark area near the right of the imager. I sent it back to Nikon's west coast repair center, where the optics were cleaned.  That fixed the dark area.It tends to freeze up when playing back its own video. When it freezes, not only does the touch screen do nothing, but it won't power off. The battery has to be removed to reset it.  This happened twice today. I've seen this reported in other reviews, so I suspect a software bug.  Is there a firmware upgrade available?Taking video, and downloading from the camera, seem to work fine.  Video works well in bright light, but becomes grainy in moderate indoor lighting.As for the design, it's hard to hold and use.  Since the whole back is a touch screen, you have to hold it withouttouching the back.  The lens is at the upper left front, so you can't hold it there or block the lens.  The shutter release is at the top right, so you can't hold it there.  It has to be held carefully, by the corners.The touch screen is frustrating. About half the time, touching something doesn't have any effect.  Others have reported this problem.I expected better from Nikon.  They used to have a great reputation.  No longer.  I will not buy another Nikon consumer product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Kirsten13
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for my trip to Disney and it really is exceptional, especially for the price. It's incredibly easy to use, them smart photo is very handy. The only issue I'm having is with the red eye editing... it's tricky to find, as well as the touch screen while scrolling through your pictures can be kind of touchy. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants an easy to use, cute, portable point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Real Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Daveydoh
Reviews.Content: This camera is really not all that bad. Before I bought it I read all the reviews and there was a lot of people who weren't to happy about it. I had played with it for a few hours at Best Buy just to have them tell me that they didn't have it in stock. (Thank you Amazon) And they only had 2 colors...Some people were complaining that the picture were coming out all blurry...and for awhile mine did that too, till I realized that if you barely hold the button it focuses, and then you press and it takes the picture crystal clear, problem solved. This camera is just so awesome, I've been playing with the settings on my own, but do intend to read the user's manual for it. It's not a professional camera, more of a point and shoot, and you can't really take pictures while moving, but that's ok since most of the pictures I like to take I like to stand still for. It even comes with a program to help you upload your pictures.I did have a problem at first with the slider on the camera it would randomly open in my pocket, but I ended up just using a case for that, since I don't like the thought of bumping into something and breaking my camera. The battery is not even that bad...it doesn't have a battery meter on the actual camera itself, but once you plug it into the computer, the main screen shows the battery gauge. And it lasts for quite awhile, I had mine charge for 3 hours+ before taking it out a test drive.The touch screen is fun too, I feel like I'm using my phone, except with a better camera on it. When flipping through the pictures, it may lag, but I found out if you start from the top right corner they flip through much faster. There is even a picture editor on the camera, which is fun to play with, it's like a miniature photoshop. I am not a professional photographer nor do I know a lot about cameras, but this camera suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Blurry photos
Reviews.Author: scorpberry
Reviews.Content: I agree with Amber, another reviewer. I've had Canon cameras for years and when it came time to upgrade, I received this one as a gift. I really tried to like it. I had it for about 2.5 weeks. We just returned it yesterday and got a Canon PowerShot SD1400IS, which is awesome. The Canon was cheaper than this one and a lot smaller, too. Also seems more durable. The Canon will also change the settings automatically for you, based on the photo you're taking. The menu(s) of settings on the Nikon was quite cumbersome and not user friendly.I like the Nikon's touch screen, and hate to be downer here, but isn't it really just one more thing to break? If it does break, you will not be able to do anything: scroll through photos, zoom, etc.I was not happy with the photo quality at all. They were all blurry and out of focus! I'd never had that problem before with my Canons. I read the manual to trouble shoot. Changed a few settings, too. Still blurry.I also didn't like that on 2 occasions, I hit the shutter and the camera didn't/wouldn't take the photo. Tried taking it from the touch screen, too (again, cool feature) and nothing. Once it was me trying to take the photo and another time it was my friend, so not sure you can say user error here.Overall, I was extremely disappointed in a camera that's supposed to be from one of the leading camera manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: And now, for something completely different....
Reviews.Author: John W. Petsinger "BuckyBeaver"
Reviews.Content: I traded up from an older Nikon Coolpix.I have owned this camera for just over a month.I have not read most of the manual, but changing settings is pretty intuitive.  And there are so MANY options....Will I EVER use the setting that allows me to take pictures of FOOD?This camera could stand a "favorites" icon or two to allow for quick changes between, say "portrait" and "backlighted portrait."The first thing you must adjust to is handling the camera from only the edges, since touching the screen can easily reset functions.Pictures taken in low light are surprisingly good.Autofocus rarely produces a bad picture.The zoom function is pretty imprecise, but not unforgiveable.Bright colors "pop" on the screen more than on the computer.I have noticed a tendency for faces in the foreground but toward the corners of the picture to be distorted.Fits in my jeans pocket for easy access.Slide open the lens, and you're good to go.This product is a GIANT step up from my four-year-old Coolpix, and about a thousand times better than the Argus C3 I carried all over the world in the Navy.

Reviews.Title: Good fit for me
Reviews.Author: M. Gonzalez "beepster"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a number of key features:- Compact camera - easy to carry about and pack- Zoom lens at least 4-5x - to allow decent framing without having to move forward and back a lot- Touch screen - with small cameras the buttons just get too small to be useful. I had a Sony touchscreen camera and loved the ease of use.- Decent picture quality and pixel count - to allow cropping when neededThis camera fulfilled all of the above, and at a good price. I'm very happy with it after over 100 photos in a variety of settings.

Reviews.Title: Just Great!
Reviews.Author: Zuleyha UNLU
Reviews.Content: I can say that I liked everything about this camera..The only thing that I can criticize is the screen, which forces me to be overcautious time to time. This is because even with a slight touch, some strange stains occur on the screen. And if you try to clean it with random rags, the stain becomes worse and the screen seems like cracked..I used my computer's cleaning rag for a few times and it worked.. But, I guess there have to be a special cleaning rag..Apart from that, it's great!

Reviews.Title: Best Coolpix yet!
Reviews.Author: Harold Rody
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with lots of features but still very simple to use. Takes great photos in light or dark. Good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Shunelle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in August 2011 and it was one of the best purchases I ever made up until someone stole it in January. It was such a good camera that I'm going to buy another one. its hrd to find  a good camera that doesnt cost an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80
Reviews.Author: Sammi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Camera! The picture quality is great and all the effects that you can add on to photos are cool. A little slow at times but not bad.  Overall, an awesome product!!!

Reviews.Title: Cheap feel, not very responsive
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: This Nikon S80 is not the digital camera for a traveler who likes to do "point and shoot" - the OLED touch screen controls are not responsive, and on top of that, it takes a while for the setting configuration to be ready for the next shot.The camera is very light with the standard Nikon battery, however, the plastic is so thin the camera feels cheap, and the shutter button gets stuck all the time, so it would take the picture before it completes focusing on the image.The 720P HD video quality is average. Picture quality is good, although a bit on the bright side with default setting but that can be adjusted with ISO and exposure, and as I said before, it takes a bit longer to get the settings right with the crappy OLED touch screen control (it can also use a MUCH faster processor), so if you don't want to miss those "moments" stay away from this camera.

Reviews.Title: Features suck, no flexibility.
Reviews.Author: Steven M
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to get a good photo with this thing.  You have no control over shutter speed or anything else.  Pictures are mostly blurry unless you have the flash on, even in broad daylight, and the flash extremely limits the depth of field (I have some great shots of the dust that's in the air between me and the object I want to shoot.)  I was hoping this would hold me over until I could afford a digital SLR but I guess I'll go back to using my wife's $20 Sony point-and-shoot camera.Anybody wanna buy a used Coolpix S80?

Reviews.Title: The best camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Heyhayblondie
Reviews.Content: This was my first camera and I loved it! All of my friends were super jealous and wanted it!! Sadly my dog knocked it off the Table and it broke:( but I am deffinetly buying another one soon! I would recommend this for any first time camera users or anyone looking for a great camera for a great price! I love this camera

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Susana Sanfiz
Reviews.Content: However I didn't quite like the touch.The configuration is overly basic.If you take a picture with flash at a distance of less than 3 metres, the objective gets literally burnt, you have to step away.On the positive list the quality of the pictures is very good.

Reviews.Title: Don't Get It!
Reviews.Author: John Mischke
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera! Ok, don't get me wrong: it's a Nikon and takes great pictures. And it's compact, sleek and sexy with a cool rubberized slide to uncover the protected lens and turn it on. Good zoom too.But... the touchscreen is hard to use and a little unresponsive. Way too hard to change any settings. Would have been nice to not have the zoom control on the touchscreen. And a touch slow on it's time from turning it on to taking your first shot. And the camera lacks some of the in-camera editing options of other Nikons.And this is incredibly annoying: when you review your images, if you delete one, it returns to last image taken. Argh! Forget editing or going thru pictures on the camera.Nikon usually makes great cameras. I can reccomend a bunch of other Nikons and other compact touchscreen cameras to choose instead of this one. If you want a great, pocket sized camera with the small lens and sliding cover, I heartily reccomend the Fuji z10, z20 and z100s. Stay away from this one!

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: WJT
Reviews.Content: Decent camera. Decent price. Nice design. I like the thinness off the camera. Picture quality pretty decent for a casual photographer. It gets blurry for long distance pictures though. The problem with this camera is that the batteries easily get out of position that you need to constantly readjust the batteries.Do not, however, buy the hard case that is recommended along with the camera. It is too small to even contain the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix S80
Reviews.Author: Yoslen A. Bolivar A "yoslenb"
Reviews.Content: excelente camara la compre hace mas de un mes y no he tenido ningun problema realice la compra desde venezuela excelente imagen y videoexcellent camera buy it over a month ago and have not had any problems buying from Venezuela make excellent image and video

Reviews.Title: NIKON S80
Reviews.Author: Arnold E. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS TO REPLACE THE S70. I LOVE THIS ONE ,THE ONLY THING  I MISS ON THE S70 IS THE MENU OPTION. OVERALL THIS IS A GREAT BUY. I LIKE THE FACT THAT IT IS MUCH THINNER THAN THE S70.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: brgates
Reviews.Content: I get a new camera every 2yrs because I use them soo much!I've never owned a Nikon before this one and have always heard mixed reviews about them.I personally love my camera though!! I love the touch screen, which surprising isn't smudged with fingerprints.I like that the front is covered by the sliding window.I've had other brands of cameras that it would just have a shutter window and then start sticking.The only thing that isn't perfect with it, is that sometimes when I'm taking a lot of pictures, out and about, and then try to customize the shot it will freeze up for about 3secs, but then go back to normal. But I think it is because I'm being impatient and overloading it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!  Great Pics!
Reviews.Author: CSandEPS "eduardo Schoen"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to take pictures of our future son.  I previously owned the Nikon Coolpix S51 and absolutely loved it.  The S51 took great pictures when using the pre-set scene modes.  I was most impressed by the Fireworks scene.  Absolutely terrific pics of fireworks.This camera, the S80, is no different in its ability to take absolutely stunning and high quality pics.  I was surprised to read reviews about this camera taking bad quality pictures.  My only guess is that those writing those reviews are: 1) Nikon haters and Canon lovers (big rivalry) or 2) don't know how to use the pre-set scenes and auto-picture features of the S80.Don't be fooled by the haters that give this camera poor reviews.  This camera takes great pictures.  I can't wait until my son is born so that I can take long lasting, high-quality pictures of him.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera
Reviews.Author: garnetkw
Reviews.Content: This camera is very user friendly and I love the touch screen features.  Once you spend some time to play with the camera and learn the features you will learn to love this camera as well.  It is so compact and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Happy wife
Reviews.Author: Adam V. Beeson "abeeson20"
Reviews.Content: My wife really wanted this for her birthday....now she won't put it down.  The picture quality is great and the functionality is terrific.  My wife uses a camera almost everyday in her occupation.  She really wanted something that was easy to use and get simple photographs.  This camera seems to hit that mark.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Purchase
Reviews.Author: Lola la Femme
Reviews.Content: I really regret buying this camera when it just came out. There were no reviews, and I paid a price for jumping the gun. Although it is compact and lightweight, the image quality is undependable - some outside shots are great; some are lousy. The flash is unpredictable. Even when I have selected a flash picture, it will work, then with the next shot, won't work (two shots in sequence). Or, one picture will come out great with the flash, the immediate next one is washed out. The on camera menu - though a great idea - is slow, unresponsive, just plain clunky. Deleting pictures is a nightmare. You delete one, then you are taken to the end of the picture stream, only to have to scroll slowly back to where you where. I would have expected Nikon to come out with some type of software update for this camera to resolve some of these issues, but nothing. Don't wast your money on this camera, even at its current price. One of the purchases I have most regretted making - i'm talking Top 3.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Dezerae
Reviews.Content: I am not a "techie" but I do love technical gadgets and I am really enjoying figuring out this camera. It can do EVERYTHING! I am still learning but it is so much fun! And not that difficult to figure out, you MUST read the user manual that comes on the cd, but it isn't hard to understand, and is laid out very well. It is a wonderful camera and I am loving it!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: onebadcrewx4
Reviews.Content: Completely disappointed.  The one i purchased and sent back had orbs in almost every photo taken at multiple locations with different lighting etc.  Many photos were blown out but the majority were fine with the exception of the orbs.  The size was great if slim is what you're after but if pictures worth keeping is what you're after i'd save some bucks and look elsewhere.  The quality wasn't any better than your average 5MP cam

Reviews.Title: NOT worth the $! Do NOT buy!
Reviews.Author: Jodie A. Manaigre
Reviews.Content: You don't have enough space for me to type all I want to type. Suffice it to say that the camera is very difficult to use. Oh sure, it came with a booklet of 'Quick Instructions,' as well as a complete instruction manual on a disc -- which, when printed out would have been 147 pages long! We just wanted a point & shoot kind of thing that gave great photos. This camera does not satisfy either prerequisite in ANY way, shape, or form. The auto-flash did not work properly & it also produced VERY poor-quality photos. I returned this for a full refund, along with the case & the memory card (why keep those if I don't have or want the camera?). Sorry, Amazon, this one's a no-go for me.

Reviews.Title: Only one complaint
Reviews.Author: Rhys
Reviews.Content: Great camera with impressive specs and very sexy look.  The only complaint is that you have to hold the camera extremely still to take a great picture.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix s80
Reviews.Author: Douglas L. Crabb
Reviews.Content: This camera is way better than i could imagine. To walk from an outside shooting setting to indoors shootings is terrific. the automatic adjustment for this is terrific. No more iso black spots or focus problems. Got to love it. The clarity and colors on playback is too good.You do have to place your hands on certain spots of the camera for I to have had my fingers showing in my shots. You just have to re-learn where to place your fingers.Touchscreen is awesome.Menu is short and sweet.Tech support and answers to questions is there for you at [...]I really am thankfull to have purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great all around, excellent in low light.
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: This camera has excellent low light capabilities, and as a nightclub employee I have found it to be an excellent tool.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: Tracy E. Elliott
Reviews.Content: The slider scratched the front of my camera almost immediately.  Also, the video size is HUGE.  Sadly, this camera hasn't been used in probably a year since I got the new HTC LTE EVO phone with amazing video and camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Virginia L Payne
Reviews.Content: I haven't been able to locate a low battery warning and when battery is low pictures are not in focus. A warning could help eliminate missing that special shot. Otherwise, I love the camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Autumn Buus
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I love it. It came quickly and was packaged very well. I'm very pleased with the camera all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Can do more than expected
Reviews.Author: BKKSC
Reviews.Content: Camera is sleek, offers advanced  features and has some cool features. Everything you need to use it comes in the box.Had the camera about a week; so far only complaint is not being to see the photos that were previously placed on SD card but I think that has something to do with the photo card not being formatted.Camera does not come w/ carrying case, but does come w/ a strap.Very happy with my purchase. Even though there are cameras that now have 16+ megapixels, the picture quality with this one is phenomenal and needless to say, my camera tops those of my friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: Screen Stopped working
Reviews.Author: TaniaB
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this camera.  I only had it for a little over a year, and it stopped working out of the blue. I can hear the flash, but the screen won't come on, even though it is fully charged. It has not been mishandled in any way. I have tried to remove the battery and recharge it, slide the panel, or long press on the power button, but to no avail. The screen won't come on. I never had that type of problem with my Kodak camera.Very frustrated customer ...AAARRRGGHH!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: per
Reviews.Content: Got this Camera as a gift so I couldn't return it. I was so excited because my last digtal camera was battery operated and would die fast. This camera looks amazing but EVERY SINGLE PICTURE COMES OUT BLURRY AND OUT OF FOCUS. I would be better off just taking a mental picture I think they would be much clear.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Shareema M. Massey "Nail Polish Junkie"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the greatest camera's I've ever owned. It's extremely fast and the pictures are clear. Uploading pics is very easy. Simply put this camera is awesome!

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Brittony
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for myself for a mother's day present... I ABSOLUTELY love this camera... I did some research before I purchased it... I love the touch screen and i love the picture quality... The only thing I don't like is that the battery doenst' tell you when it's getting low... There has been many times I have been in the middle of a family trip and go to take a picture and the camera just dies... very irritating but that's okay...

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: F. Burrowes
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that was small enough to pocket in my jeans and easy to use. A no brainer type of camera. This camera works great for what I need. The colors are vibrant, but with one touch of the screen you can create a black and white. The video is 16:9 wide screen in 720p. Sound is recorded through a left and right receiver to provide a good clear sound. I have yet to try it in very loud sound situations. This one because its cheap, small, powerful, easy to use, and provides great images and video.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: malibu219
Reviews.Content: I recently replaced my Olympus with this Nikon. I was in love with my Olympus but this is coming in a close second. The one bad thing about it is when you are previewing pics and delete one...the camera goes all the back to the last picture taken so you have to scroll through all the ones you already looked at to get back to the spot you left off.

Reviews.Title: Ashton kutcher
Reviews.Author: tenurse
Reviews.Content: Yaaaa ashton - thanks for the hot tip - awesome camera I absolutely love it - I was sent the wrong color jellyfish case ( supposed to get pink one to match pink camera) but otherwise no complaints at all ...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: gizmoruby
Reviews.Content: This camera is a wonderful addition to any home arsenal of electronics.Up Side:It takes standard memory  14mp Pictures!  Charging cord doubles as USB cordDown Side :Not so great in dark enviroments  Touch screen takes a while to get used to

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Kayla Marie
Reviews.Content: First thing I noticed when I got the camera; GET A CASE. The camera is beautiful and sleek with its touchscreen, but that also means that it's highly breakable. When you first get it, you SHOULD charge it, but I didn't and went to an outdoor party with it. Even first out of the package it will work for about an hour or two. It takes gorgeous pictures and the editing features on the camera are nice as well.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Seyer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift. It is great! It takes really nice pictures. The screen is a touch screen and a decent size for a digital camera. The camera turns on and off with the slide of the dark pink piece. It is a rechargeable battery and comes with usb cables. I am really pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: I gotta admit, this camera is good. i was a little sketch about this camera because it was being sold for so much less and came out like 2 months ago but this camera is great for me. i am a college student traveling, and having fun and this camera may be a little much for a college student, but im glad i can save it forever now.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Camerna
Reviews.Author: San123
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Picture quality is great. The screen is big and the quality of the touch screen is excellent,

Reviews.Title: Bad Luck and Bad Pics
Reviews.Author: Bart
Reviews.Content: Had it for 3 weeks and 148 pics later, it wouldn't turn on or charge.  Had to take it back.  Bad Luck I guess, but before that happened I;Used the camera for my boys basketball game.  Would not keep up even in sport mode.  Pics were blurry.  Tried other modes, but couldn't seem to get it to take clear pics.  Held it really tight, thinking it was me, but very difficult.  I did get some good photos though.  Maybe more practice needed.Used the camera at my sons Christmas service in a church which was dark, with christmas lights behind the kids on stage.  Obviously it was difficult to get clean pics without the sparkle affect.  I ended up using the sunrise mode and it worked well, but once again hard to keep the camera steady for still photos.While using it at home in house lighting, it decided to either take very yellow based photos or really spectacular ones.  Not sure what the camera was doing.  I was in easy *dummy* mode and I suppose alot of it had to be with the lighting.  But back to back photos in easy mode should look similar, not completely different.I tried many different features on this camera for photo shooting only, and struggled every time.  Not user friendly.I did not work with the video recording since the battery failed so early in the camera's life.The touch screen was nice, but found by accident that you can take pics with the touch of the screen.  Many pics of the back of the chair.  But practice would alleviate that problem.All in all, this camera has many features, not a user friendly camera in my mind, and I was actually glad the battery failed so that I had a good reason to give up and take it back.If you're looking for an easy camera to use that takes good photos...buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Mohanty
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product specially for women and children. Because of not having zoom lense there is no fear of damage to the lense. Touch screen works great and the picture quality is also very good. Good for beginers.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the worst we have had
Reviews.Author: Daniel Moore
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this camera is a lemon or bad design. We got it for a trip and it has given us nothing but trouble since we started our trip. Sometimes it doesn't turn on and sometimes it does. No clue as to when it will work. As soon as we return from the trip, we plan on returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately an inferior camera in a very cool package.
Reviews.Author: Masakazu Roy Nakamura "www.HotWheelsNow.com"
Reviews.Content: I've had many point and shoot cameras.  To replace my aging Pentex Optio P80 I bought a Nikon COOLPIX S80.  In a nutshell...the camera has some very cool looking features...but in an indoor environment with low lighting...I find that the camera is worthless.  Blurry pics with unpredictable skin tones...also fingers tend to interfere with the flash...and also appear in many photos accidentally due to the location of the lens. I'm not the only dummy who has discovered this...when I lent my camera to my friends to take some pictures at a party...they had the same issues. I am returning this Camera despite any restocking fees.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Works well. Looks sweet. She loves it was her fav Chtistmas gift.  The large screan us so nice. It is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good purchase
Reviews.Author: mr joe
Reviews.Content: my mom's friend had this camera and she fell in love with it. i got it for her b-day and she says its her best one yet. she uses it a few times per week. the shipper sent it fast and it was well packaged

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: J. Haupt
Reviews.Content: I bought this digital camera for my daughter for her birthday and she loves it! She is still learning how to use it and enjoying the process.

Reviews.Title: It is a cool stuff
Reviews.Author: yangjx90
Reviews.Content: It is so cool. Thin, easy to use, especially easy to turn on and off. I like the feeling of touching. Also, the blue colour is cool.

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: Katrinka A. Morris "omamorris"
Reviews.Content: This camera was very much an update for me . I like the features it has and the touch screen. But ultimately I had trouble using it many photos were blurred and had my finger in them because the camera is clumsy to use....so I ended up returning it.

Reviews.Title: Too Many Flaws
Reviews.Author: A. Cana
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for vacation in Hawaii.  Immediately I discovered some major flaws.1.  The touch screen is not the most time efficient.  There's a lag (maybe Im spoiled with the iPad).  Also when looking through pictures, if you wanna delete one it'll take you all the way back to the beginning of the set.2.  The lens is on to way top left corner on a thin camera so unless you know correctly every time, it's easy to get your finger in the corner of the pic.3.  Pictures come out good outdoors, but indoors it's like playing the lotto.  Consecutive pics without changing any settings come out with different lighting and lots of time blurry.  It's so odd.I'm sure there are a few other I forgot to mention, but these alone are enough for me to return it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80 rip off
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: Terrible quality pictures has halos around brighter objects. Touch screen work as long as you have plenty of time to play with it. Nikon USA will not respond with assistance of any kind up to and including sending it to them for repair, or offering any repair opportunities. Unfortunately I have to return it and will buy a Canon or other. It is sad because I have always been satisfied with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very cool coolpix best I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: acg123
Reviews.Content: Very cool! coolpix best I've ever owned.. You can do so much editing on the camera you hardly need a computer software to fix up your photos.

Reviews.Title: screen does not appear
Reviews.Author: karnny
Reviews.Content: My husband has been using this camera and loved it.  Yesterday he slid the cover to open it and the screen did not come on.  You can hear it "ping" when the screen is touched, but the screen is dark.  It will flash when the button is pressed, but the screen still does not come on.  We actually printed out the manual which is 190 pages and could not find anything that references this problem.  We have removed the battery, tried to recharge the battery and nothing brings up the screen.  Has anyone else had this problem?  Too much money to just say "oh well"

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80 is pretty good
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: I have found that the OLED screen can be touchy. That is, it can take several tries to open or close a tab. I prefer the manual controls I had on my S1.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable investment
Reviews.Author: Hung C. Huynh
Reviews.Content: With the price dropped comparing with the original one, it makes this camera very compeling and great product.  I have read lots of review about this camera and all the Cons mentioned are no longer applicable to this price.  My wife loved the stylist design, bigger touch screen, and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.5-Inch OLED Touchscreen and 5x Wide-Angle Zoom Nikkor ED Lens
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Orndorff
Reviews.Content: This is a very good small camera,not too complicated to operate and takes good pictures.The only con thing I find is the battery needs to be charged more often than I would like.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Junior
Reviews.Content: It's a good product, this quality is ok, and i'm happy with this shoes. I think, if other persons buy this product, they are the same opinion

Reviews.Title: great fun camera
Reviews.Author: soon2bwyatt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera it is easy to use and takes great pictures, very crisp and sharp detail. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Not too satisfied with it
Reviews.Author: Mplaza
Reviews.Content: The size of the camera is great BUT is very hard to usea the touch screen, sometimes it seems not to work properly... I don't know if this is a damage of the camera or is difficult to use... por example, I can change the date without any problem but for the time I have to click several times until it works...Hope it's get better because I used to buy only SONY but decide to prove NIKON because Im looking fo a semir pro camera of this same company

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon D40 and was looking for a small camera that was more convenient.  Just received this one as a gift and the camera is a waste of money.  Horrible blurry photos with bad lighting.  Added bonus camera keeps turning off and then has to be plugged back in to work again.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!  Returning this one immediately.I would give it zero stars if Amazon would let me.

Reviews.Title: Suckiest camera ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Jamie Johnson "Jamie"
Reviews.Content: DO NOT GET THIS CAMERA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the pictures are always blury the zoom sucks and you have to push the buttons on the touch screen like 4 times to get them to work it takes a LONG time to start up and for $300 should be $50! its the worst camera EVER and i have had some pretty bad cameras i returned it the 2nd day i had it. if u must try it get it from costco they have a 90 day return policy. i recommend the cannon _____________  i got it and the pictures are fantastic! just dont get it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: midanah
Reviews.Content: It's ok for the price. The outside pictures are really the good ones. I don;t like the close ups inside but overall is an OK camera.

Reviews.Title: Two functions are better than one
Reviews.Author: Stanley Zak "Stanzak"
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat skeptical of a small point and shoot camera that does both video and still well. I was very happy with the Nikon's performance in both categories.

Reviews.Title: Nikon sux
Reviews.Author: Nikon sux
Reviews.Content: Right after the allowable return period is over, the flash stops to work.  I now have a $200 electronic paper wieight.  Great!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix not so cool
Reviews.Author: asqauto
Reviews.Content: Camera does not work right out of the box.  The battery keeps shut down and will not charge.  I requested for an replacememt.  I will give it another try.  Very dissappointed, however.

Reviews.Title: nikons80
Reviews.Author: bluep
Reviews.Content: the nikon s 80 is one of the best cameras we have ever used it takes great pictures and the features are great,we love it.

Reviews.Title: Artsy
Reviews.Author: Artsy
Reviews.Content: Great compact camera...very new to me...have not used it yet... Like the touch screen...ease of use...looking forward to lots of use ...more to come after lots of pix...and final printed pix.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: wasayanwer97
Reviews.Content: This camera is the worst I have ever used. Nikon's products AND customer service both suck. We have had so many problems with this camera it is astounding. First, there was a charging problem and Nikon had our camera for a month,only to tell us our problem was THE FREAKING USB CORD. They were even about to charge us $90 even though we were under warranty. Now, we are having random screen problems where the camera is on, sounds work, but the screen isn't working. Save yourself some trouble, don't buy Nikon.

Reviews.Title: The promotion of buying S80 with a 4 GB SD flashing memory card
Reviews.Author: Kam Kwok
Reviews.Content: I bought a S80 and a S8100 were under the promotion of buying a S80 and a S8100 with a free gift 4 GB SD flashing memory card from Amazon. I tried to follow the link and the procedure, but when I received my two orders, I discovered there were no any free gift 4 GB SD memory cards inside. I ever tried to send the feed back to Amazon.com with nil result. Would you like to follow my case or transfer my case to the concerned Department. Thanks a lot!  Yours sincerely,  Kam Kwok

Reviews.Title: Return polacy---It is terrable
Reviews.Author: John1111
Reviews.Content: I did not see or know that the return polocy was 30 days. Had I know amazons polcy I would not have bought the item. Or the cammera case. I gave the camera  as a gift to a friend. The 30 day return polacy startrd on the date of purchase(Dec.19,2010). I receive the camera by mail 4 days later. My friend keep the camera for about 10 days. She inform me that she had read the reviews,inspected the cammera, and did not like the feature of receiveing the Owner Mannual by having to go to the company/ manufacture web site for important information one would need to know in the operation. When I had the first opportunety to return the items, I realized I would not be able to meet the deadline. Now I have a cammera that I don't need.  The cammera case is now usless. I paid $5.95. It would have cost as much as the case itself returing it to the vender.  It WAS A TOUGHT LESSION..."DON'T BUY FROM AMAZON"...  I know that the company will not put this note on it's web page. So be it.

Reviews.Title: Good product.........poor service(gift wrap option)
Reviews.Author: Hannah B
Reviews.Content: The product appears to be looking great from the box.......have not taken it out of of the box because its a Xmas gift and I'm just a little disappointed that I specifically selected/paid for the gift wrap option an wrote the 2 line note an the gift was not wrapped.....but came wit the note.This camera is still gonna be the perfect Xmas gift. I used the S70 ah few times an was impressed......excellent product.Ohhhhh an it came like 3 days b4 the estimated date of arrival....lol

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1-megapixel CCD sensor for stunning images; 5x wide-angle optical Zoom-Nikkor ED glass lens
3.5-inch Ultra-High Resolution (819,000-dot) Organic LED (OLED) Clear Color Display
HD (720p) Movie with Stereo and HDMI Output
5-way VR Image Stabilization System
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S80 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 3.5-Inch OLED Touchscreen and 5x Wide-Angle Zoom Nikkor ED Lens (Blue)
